1.text: My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct, the grave is ready for me.

2.text: Surely there are mockers with me, and mine eye abideth in their provocation.

3.text: Give now a pledge, be surety for me with thyself; who is there that will strike hands with me?

4.text: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.

5.text: He that denounceth his friends for a prey, even the eyes of his children shall fail.

6.text: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and I am become an open abhorring.

7.text: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.

8.text: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.

9.text: Yet shall the righteous hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall wax stronger and stronger.

10.text: But return ye, all of you, and come now: and I shall not find a wise man among you.

11.text: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the droughts of my heart.

12.text: They change the night into a day: the fight, say they, is near unto the darkness.

13.text: If I look for Sheol as mine house; if I have spread my couch in the darkness;

14.text: If I have said to corruption, Thou art my father; to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister;

15.text: Where then is my hope? and as for my hope, who shall see it?

16.text: It shall go down to the bars of Sheol, when once there is rest in the dust.
